slides.text:
-Tendons of insertion of the supraspinatus, infraspinatus and subscapularis muscles act as active collateral ligaments
-Vital role in stabilising shoulder joint
-GLENOHUMERAL LIGAMENTS: thickening of joint caps, relatively weak
-movement is mainly FLEXION and EXTENSION

1: SUPRASPINOUS FOSSA

2: SPINE OF THE SCAPULA

3: SCAPULA

4: INFRASPINOUS FOSSA

5: GREATER TUBERCLE OF THE HUMERUS

6: GLENOID CAVITY

7: HEAD OF THE HUMERUS

1: MEDIAL GLENOHUMERAL LIGAMENT

2: Tendon of the SUPRASPINATUS muscle

3: LATERAL GLENOHUMERAL LIGAMENT

4: Tendon of insertion of the INFRASPINATUS muscle

1: RADIAL FOSSA

2: MEDIAL EPICONDYLE

3: ANCONEAL PROCESS

4: OLECRANON OF THE ULNA



5: LATERAL EPICONDYLE

OLECRANON LIGAMENT:
medial wall of radial fossa and olecranon (prevents extensive flexion)

pages.title: Right elbow of the dog (caudal aspect of the joint)

slides.text:
OBLIQUE LIGAMENT:
prevents excessive extension (beyond 180 degrees)

1: MEDIAL COLLATERAL LIGAMENT

2: Tendon of insertion of biceps brachii

3: ANNULAR LIGAMENT:
holds the tendons in place across the joint but also allows the rotation of the radius

pages.title: Right elbow of the dog (cranial aspect)

slides.text:
1: ANCONEAL PROCESS

2: TROCHLEAR NOTCH



3: OLECRANON OF THE ULNA

1: Tendon of insertion of biceps brachii

2: MEDIAL COLLATERAL LIGAMENT:
along with the lateral collateral ligament, limits medial and lateral movement

pages.title: Right elbow of the dog (medial aspect)

slides.text:
1: FIBROUS JOINT CAPSULE

2: ACCESSORY CARPAL BONE:
non weight-bearing

3: DISTAL ROW:
RADIOCARPAL BONE
INTERMEDIO CARPAL BONE

4: ULNA CARPAL BONE

5: 4TH CARPAL BONE

6: 1ST DIGIT:
non weight-bearing due to claw

7: METACARPAL BONES

1: ANTEBRACHIAL CARPAL JOINT:
has the greatest movement

2: MIDDLE CARPAL JOINT

3: CARPOMETACARPAL JOINT

pages.title: Bones and joints at the carpus

slides.text:
FIBROUS JOINT CAPSULE:
-thickened on palmar aspect to from PALMAR CARPAL LIGAMENT
-encloses all three joints
-collagenous/cartilaginous - provides smooth surface for passage of flexor tendons, blood vessels and nerves

1: FIBROUS JOINT CAPSULE:
-forms exterior retinaculum
-surrounds extensor tendon

2: ANTEBRACHIAL CARPAL JOINT:
-has its own synovial membrane
-50 to 60 degrees of FLEXION

3: MIDDLE CARPAL JOINT:
-15 degrees of FLEXION
-shares a synovial membrane and joints communicate

4: CARPOMETACARPAL JOINT:
-5 degrees of FLEXION
